page.title: 09HOUSING : ALDERLEY EDGE
page.content: The population in Alderley Edge grew with the{coming of the railway in {1848.}At that time the wealthy {Victorian society }built houses on the Edge,while the{lower classes}built up the village centre.Since then there has been extensive development in the area.A{post war council estate}lies to the north of the village and several {private housing estates}have sprung up on the remaining land. During our survey we visited new building sites.The main consideration seems to be{quality rather than cost. The major features are luxurious kitchens and bathrooms,double glazed windows and an emphasis on security locks to the interior. The materials used include red brick,slate roofs,plastic drainpipes,metal garage doors and quality wood.
